channel.title: Restarting before booting
channel.description:
I've had this new pc for like a month and a problem I've had since the start is that when ever you turn it on it sounds like everything is spinning up then it turns itself off and then a few seconds later it turns itself back on and then continues to boot and loads up normally.
It's not really a problem but I guess it must add a few seconds to the boot time, and considering I have an ssd it's lame to try and show how fast it boots.
Any idea why this is happening + how to fix it?

item.title: Restarting before booting
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Niall:

you’ve got the same mobo as me, I had this problem and it’s due to some of the mobo features for things that you likely don’t have, so go through your mobo and disable absolutely everything you do not need and it’ll be fine

Arg that’s gonna take ages I have absolutely no idea what most of the stuff im bios does, and most of the options are enabled. Thanks though at least I know the problem now

Read full topic

item.title: Restarting before booting
item.dc:creator: @zammyking111 zammyking111
item.description:
@zammyking111 wrote:

Does it even show windows? Try the bootsector if so…

also check ram…

Read full topic

item.title: Restarting before booting
item.dc:creator: @vortex vortex
item.description:
@vortex wrote:

Maybe the system runs some tests each time you boot

Read full topic

item.title: Restarting before booting
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

Mine does that after overclocking horribly wrong, try using default bios settings.

Read full topic

item.title: Restarting before booting
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yeah, my computer does this if I have a dodgy BIOS setting. It boots up into the saved settings, if it doesn’t like them or remembers problems that occurred under that setting, it reboots it back into BIOS defaults.

It won’t do that more than once though since my motherboard has a few BIOS chips that just default onto another one and let you rewrite on to the other when you want to. Or something like that.

Read full topic

item.title: Restarting before booting
item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Check though your BIOS settings, there might be something in there

Read full topic
